detail.content: New York University - Faculty and Graduate Student Projects                                                                                                                             New York University       Skip to Content    Skip to Search    Skip to Navigation    Skip to Sub Navigation                                               New York University                                              Projects on NYU Web        Below is a list of some of the current project web sites housed on NYU Web. These are project sites of faculty members and graduate students.          Aphrodisias  A project site devoted to the Archaeological research at Aphrodisias, sponsored by The Institute of Fine Arts and the Faculty of Arts and Sciences at NYU.     The Arora Lab  The lab site for the research of Paramjit S. Arora.     Russian Peasants Go to Court: Legal Culture in the Countryside, 1905-1917 Russian Peasants Go to Court explores the legal practice of Russian peasants in the early twentiethcentury. This site is an online version of the book by NYU Professor of History, Jane Burbank .     CARE  The site for the National Commission on Asian American and Pacific Islander Research in Education.     Lucas Champollion  Home page for NYU Faculty member Lucas Champollion.     Crosstalk Program  A research project site for initiatives at NYU College of Dentistry, NYU School of Medicine, Aaron Diamond AIDS Research Center and Rockefeller University.     Dancing With My Father  The site for NYU Journalism faculty member Marcia Rock's personal documentary about how we learn to give and receive love.     Laboratory for Molecular Genetics  Molecular Genetics Lab of NYU Biology professor Claude Desplan.     Early Book Society  The site for the Early Book Society; a group devoted to the study of manuscripts and early printed books.     Eurasian Connections  "Eurasian Connections" explores the historical and cultural significance of the societies and polities on Eurasia's great landmass.     Fitch Lab  The home page for Biology professor David Fitch's research.     DNA Chemistry and Photophysics Geacintov Lab  Chemistry professor Nicolas Geacintov's project page.     Theresa Jordan's Research  Site for Steinhardt faculty member Theresa Jordan's research and publications.     A World Community of Old Trees  An Eco-Art Project in Progress by June Julian.     Kallenbach's Lab Page  Home page for Chemistry faculty member Neville Kallenbach's research.     The Kirshenbaum Lab  Site for Chemistry faculty member Kent Kirshenbaum's research.     Virtual Commons Modules  Various sites from GSP faculty members.     Jonathan Morduch  Home page for Wagner faculty member Jonathan Morduch.     Helen Nissenbaum  Home page for NYU Faculty member Helen Nissenbaum.     Bertel Ollman  The project site for NYU Politics Department professor Bertel Ollman.     Victor Rodwin  Home page for Wagner faculty member Victor Rodwin.     Salt Harvesters of Ghana  The site for NYU Journalism faculty member Marcia Rock's film about the female salt harvesters of Ghana.     The Margaret Sanger Papers Project  A web site created by the NYU Department of History to celebrate the life and work of Margaret Sanger.     The Fullerene Group  NYU Chemistry professor David Schuster's fullerene research site.     Chris Sciabarra  The research project homepage for Department of Politics scholar Chris Sciabarra.     Surrender Tango  The site for NYU Journalism faculty member Marcia Rock's film about the mystery of the tango connection.     Theater Without Borders  A research collaborative to advance knowledge of the transnational and comparative impact of Early Modern Drama.     Values in Technology Design  The web site of Values in Technology Design: Democracy, Autonomy, and Justice , a project at NYU supported by the Ford Foundation's Knowledge, Creativity, and Freedom Program.     American Institute of Verdi Studies  The American Institute for Verdi Studies at New York University is America's leading research center for the life and works of Giuseppe Verdi.     Walters Lab  Chemistry faculty member Marc Walter's lab and research site.     William K. Everson Collection  An archive site of the works of former TSOA Cinema Studies Professor, William K. Everson.   Yeronisos Island Expedition  Timothy Donehoo's archaeological site web project.     Yingkai Zhang Lab Page  Research site for Chemistry professor Yingkai Zhang.                                         For information about how to obtain an account to create a project website hosted under this directory, please visit: www.nyu.edu/its/accounts/webmaster.html     If you currently maintain a site and would like to see it listed, please write to webteam@nyu.edu .                                                  Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. All rights reserved.       Designed by The Office of Web Communications

Here you will find useful information about the University's construction projects, including project descriptions, announcements, and answers to frequently asked questions. For details click on pins in the interactive map or visit current projects »            Spotlight on Current Projects                      Construction on the Superblocks                     Academic Space Renovations 383 Lafayette                     Renovations at Hayden Hall 33 Wash Sq West                     NYU College of Nursing 433 First Avenue              Stay Connected            General Inquiries     During normal business hours, (Monday through Friday, 9:00 am - 5:00 pm), contact the NYU Office of Government and Community Affairs , the University's primary liaison to the community, at community.affairs@nyu.edu or 212.998.2400.   Outside of normal business hours, contact the NYU Office of Facilities & Construction Management at contactcsc@nyu.edu or 212.998.1001.              For questions regarding projects at the NYU Langone Medical Center and NYU School of Medicine , contact the Langone Medical Center's Real Estate Development Office .            Sign Up for Updates       Want to receive updates about NYU construction projects in your neighborhood? Fill out our online form to receive word if a construction project happens nearby. Join the list »                           Announcements              383 Lafayette Street     April 10, 2014  Interior work continues. The permanent lane closure is scheduled for the week of April 13th. Read more »              726 Broadway     April 10, 2015  Interior construction continues. The sidewalk fence instllation and Con Edision work commences the week of April 13th. Read more »            33 Washington Sq W, Hayden Hall   March 13, 2015  Contractors are scheduled to work on Saturday, March 14. Work hours are scheduled from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm. Read more »            Con Edison Vault on Greene Street     February 6, 2015  Con Edison is scheduled to begin work on their vault on Greene Street between Washington Place and West 4th Street on Monday, February 9, 2015. Weather permitting, the work is scheduled to occur over three weeks. The work will include repairs to the vault, the installation of reinforced steel, and a concrete pour.   Con Edison’s work hours will be Monday to Friday, 7:00 am to 3:00 pm.            4 Washington Place, Meyer   January 22, 2015  A packer truck will be staged on Mercer for debris removal Monday - Friday from 7:00 pm - 9:00 pm, starting on January 22 through January 31. Read more »            For previous updates, explore individual project pages. New PTAC (provide air conditioning and heating) units, insulation, and other sound-attenuating materials will also be installed in the existing metal cabinet covers in apartments.   20 Cooper Square, Internal Renovation and Facade Work   New York University will be renovating the 1st and 2nd floor of 20 Cooper Square. This project will include internal renovation, Local Law 11 facade work, window and shutter renewal, and the installation of a rooftop cooling tower.   3 Washington Square Village, Community Board 2 Offices Exterior  NYU will repair the overhead canopy and exterior staircase of the Community Board 2 offices on LaGuardia Place.   3-5 Washington Place, Roof Replacement  NYU will replace the roof of 3-5 Washington Place.     33 Washington Square West, Hayden Hall Dormitory Renovation and Local Law 11 Facade Repairs   NYU will renovate the dormitory spaces, building offices, common areas, and life safety systems at its Hayden Hall dormitory. The project also calls for Local Law 11 facade maintenance work and connecting the building to the University's cogeneration plant.   35 Fifth Avenue, Rubin Hall 1st Floor Renovation and Roof Replacement   NYU will renovate new classroom spaces on the 1st floor, replace the roof, and install new rooftop HVAC equipment.   370 Jay Street Project   NYU will renovate the long-dormant, City-owned 370 Jay Street in Downtown Brooklyn to create a modern, sustainable, academic center for New York University’s expanding Engineering and Applied Sciences programs in Brooklyn.   383 Lafayette Street, Academic Support Center Renovation   An internal renovation will create academic spaces and a student support center for matters such as financial aid counseling, admissions, and international studies.   4 Washington Place, Meyer Building, Internal Renovations   New York University will be renovating the 1st, 4th and 7th floors of the Meyer Building. This project will include internal demolition, abatement, and renovation work.   60 Fifth Avenue, Forbes Building Renovation  NYU will renovate the building to create a modern, sustainable, academic center creating space for academic programs and classrooms.     726 Broadway, Physics Lab Renovations   NYU will renovating the 8th, 9th, and 10th floors of 726 Broadway which will be home to Physics labs.   80 Washington Square East, Goddard Hall Roof Replacement  NYU will replace the main and secondary bulkhead roofs of Goddard Hall.   LaGuardia Place Retail Space Renovation  NYU will renovate three vacant storefronts in the LaGuardia Place retail strip. These spaces will become the LaGuardia Studio, a 3-D printing facility, and the LaGuardia Co-op, a student technology center.   Othmer Hall Local Law 11 Repairs  NYU will be undertaking standard Local Law 11 repairs to the facade of Othmer Hall.     Rogers Hall Project  NYU will complete internal renovations, facade restoration, roof work, and the installation of new windows at Rogers Hall.   Superblocks Construction  A number of maintenance operations, public space beautification projects, and infrastructural improvements will happen on the superblock grounds and facilities.   Washington Square Village Roof Replacement and Local Law 11 Facade Repairs  NYU will replace the roofs of all four WSV buildings to address the frequent occurrence of leaks. Concurrently, Local Law 11 work will be performed.     Washington Square Village Window Replacement  NYU is replacing all single-paned windows in Washington Square Village with new double-paned windows. Insulation and sound-attenuating covers for built-in air conditioning units will also be installed in each apartment.   Wunsch Hall Renovation  NYU will renovate Wunsch Hall. The project includes interior renovation and the replacement and repair of critical internal infrastructure.                                                          Construction on the Superblocks Maintenance, public space beautification, and infrastructural work. Read More                    Frequently Asked Questions Here are a set of common inquiries about NYU's construction protocols. Outside of normal business hours, contact the NYU Office of Facilities & Construction Management at contactcsc@nyu.edu or 212.998.1001. Join the list »            Construction at NYU Langone      This page collects information about construction near NYU's main Washington Square campus as well as projects relating to the NYU Colleges of Dentistry and Nursing. For questions regarding projects at the NYU Langone Medical Center and NYU School of Medicine , refer to the Langone Medical Center's Real Estate Development Office .
